docs.summary:
The wix-pricing-plans-backend module contains functionality for managing your
 site's pricing plans from backend code.
description: Using the related [Paid Plans](wix-paid-plans.html) API, you can build a customized membership plan experience based
on the plans that you create and manage with the Pricing Plan APIs.
To use APIs to manage your plans, first set up your site to:
* Accept payments as described in [About Accepting Payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-accepting-payments).
* Offer membership plans as described in [About Pricing Plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-pricing-plans). When setting up your site to accept pricing plans,
[define the plans you want to offer](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-a-plan-in-pricing-plans).
### Set Up and Manage Pricing Plans
You can use the Pricing Plans API to create and manage plans. You can:
+ Create and update pricing plans.
+ List and query pricing plans.
+ Set which plans are public and which plans are hidden.
+ Archive plans.
+ Set or clear the primary plan.
+ Get statistics about the plans.
+ Rearrange the order of how plans display.
When your plans are set up, you can use the [Paid Plans](wix-paid-plans/introduction/) APIs to:
+ Let site visitors [purchase](wix-paid-plans/purchasePlan) a plan directly, as if they were using the Pricing Plans app in the Wix Editor.
+ Let site visitors [purchase](wix-paid-plans/orderPlan) a plan using your own customized process.
+ Let site visitors [cancel](wix-paid-plans/cancelPlan) plan subscriptions (orders) that they have purchased.
### About Ordering Pricing Plans
Plans can be purchased or ordered.
+ A purchase created by the APIs is similar to purchasing a plan directly on a site.
+ Ordering a plan with APIs gives you the opportunity to customize the purchase process, such as by adding your own lightboxes
and forms.
Plans can be purchased multiple times by different site members. When creating or updating a plan, you can set how many times a
plan can be purchased.
Updating the properties of a pricing plan does not affect any current purchases of the plan by site members. The purchases retain
their existing terms and pricing.
### Pricing Plan Types and Visibility
+ **Public pricing plans** are visible plans that site members and visitors can see on the site and purchase. By default, pricing plans are public when created.

+ **Hidden pricing plans** are plans whose visibility has been set to `false`. These plans cannot be seen on the site by the site member or visitor. For example, consider hiding a plan if it has reached its maximum capacity and temporarily is not available for purchase.
Changing a planâ€™s visibility does not impact existing purchases. All purchases for hidden plans are still active and keep their benefits.
+ **Active pricing plans** include all non-archived plans (such as public plans and hidden plans).
+ **Archived pricing plans** are plans that are no longer needed on the site, for example, discontinued plans.
When a plan is archived, it is no longer visible as a public plan that can be chosen by site members or visitors. Archived plans cannot be purchased.
Site owners can see archived plans in the Dashboard under **Pricing Plans -> Archived Plans**.
Archiving cannot be reversed (meaning, once archived, a plan cannot be set as active again for site members/visitors to purchase).
Archiving does not impact existing purchased made for the plan. All purchases are still active and keep their benefits.
To use the Pricing Plans API, import `wixPricingPlansBackend` from the `wix-pricing-plans-backend` module.
> **Note**: The Pricing Plans API currently uses ordering and purchasing functionality provided by the soon-to-be deprecated [Paid Plans API](wix-paid-plans.html).
To use Velo for customized plan ordering and purchasing, import `wixPaidPlans` from the `wix-paid-plans` module also, until ordering
and purchasing is available from the Pricing Plans API.
```javascript
import wixPricingPlansBackend from 'wix-pricing-plans-backend'; // for managing plans
import wixPaidPlans from 'wix-paid-plans';    // for customized, client-side plan ordering and purchasing

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the active plan to archive. An attempt to archive an already-archived plan throws an error.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The archived plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Archives a single plan.
description: The `archivePlan()` function returns a promise that resolves to the newly-archived plan.
When a plan is archived, it is no longer available for display or selection by
site members or visitors. Archived plans cannot be purchased.
An archived plan cannot be made active again.
Plan archiving does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases for the
plan are still active and keep their benefits.
Site owners can see archived plans in the Dashboard under **Pricing Plans -> Archived Plans**.

examples.title: Archive a plan
body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to a plan object for the archived plan:
*    "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

params.name: ids
params.doc: IDs of all non-archived plans in the order you want them to be arranged.

docs.summary: Changes the display order of the plans on the site page and the Dashboard.
description: The `arrangePlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the plans are rearranged
on the site page and the Dashboard.
To rearrange the order of the plans, provide a list of IDs for all
non-archived plans in the desired order, including hidden plans.
> **Note:** Provide *all* non-archived plan IDs to avoid unpredictable results.

examples.title: Arrange plans
body: // The ids object contains a full list of non-archived IDs,
// Plans are rearranged on the site page and the Dashboard.
// Returns a promise that resolves to void.

docs.summary: Sets all pricing plans as not primary.
description: The `clearPrimary()` function returns a Promise that resolves when no pricing plan is
marked as a primary plan.
After clearing the primary plan, when viewing pricing plans on the site, no plan
is highlighted with a customizable ribbon.

examples.title: Make no plans primary
body: // No pricing plans are set as primary.
// Returns a promise that resolves to void.

params.name: planInfo
params.doc: The information for the plan being created.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The created plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Creates a pricing plan.
description: The `createPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a newly-created pricing plan after it has successfully been created.
The passed `PlanInfo` object must contain at least pricing model: a recurring subscription, payment for a specific duration, or payment for
an unlimited amount of time (until cancelled).
Pricing plans created by this function are available to the site owner in the Pricing Plans section in the site's dashboard.

examples.title: Create a plan
body: "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",
*   "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the plan to get.

docs.summary: Gets an existing pricing plan by ID.
description: The `getPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a plan whose ID
matches the given ID.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Overall statistics about the pricing plans.

docs.summary: Gets statistics about the pricing plans.
description: The `getPlansStats()` function returns a Promise that resolves to statistics about the plans
on the site.
Currently this function provides only the total number of pricing plans.

examples.title: Get statistics for the pricing plans
body: /* Statistic relevant to the site's pricing plans:
*   "total": 68     // Count of all plans (public, hidden and archived)

params.name: limit
params.doc: Number of pricing plans to list. Defaults to 50.

params.name: offset
params.doc: Number of pricing plans to skip. Defaults to 0.

params.name: planIds
params.doc: IDs of plans to list. If not specified, all plans are listed. If non-existent IDs are specified, they are ignored and do not cause errors.

params.name: archived
params.doc:
Archived filter. Defaults to ACTIVE (not archived) only.
One of:
 + `"ACTIVE"`
 + `"ARCHIVED"`
 + `"ARCHIVED_AND_ACTIVE"`

params.name: public
params.doc:
Visibility filter. Defaults to PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN (meaning, both are listed).
One of:
 + `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"`
 + `"PUBLIC"`
 + `"HIDDEN"`

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of all non-archived plans.

docs.summary: Lists pricing plans.
description: The `listPlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 pricing plans.

examples.title: List plans
body: return wixPricingPlansBackend.listPlans(limit, offset, planIds, archived, public)
console.log(result);    // Array of all the specified pricing plan objects that match the criteria

params.name: limit
params.doc: Number of items to list. See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).

params.name: offset
params.doc: Number of items to skip. See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/pagination).

params.name: planIds
params.doc: IDs of plans to list. Non-existent IDs will be ignored and won't cause errors.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of public pricing plans.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 public pricing plans.

examples.title: List public plans
body: console.log(result);  // Array of the specified public pricing plan objects

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the plan to be set as the primary plan.

docs.summary: Marks a pricing plan as the primary pricing plan.
description: The `makePlanPrimary()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
pricing plan that is now the primary one.
When viewing pricing plans on the site, the primary plan is highlighted
with a customizable ribbon.

examples.title: Make a plan a primary plan
body: /* Full plan object - primary is true:
*         "There are no words to describe this extreme game!",

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The results of a public pricing plans query, containing the retrieved items.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of up to 1,000 public pricing plans, given the provided pagination, sorting, and filtering.
description: The `queryPublicPlans()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of public plans and returns a
[PublicPlansQueryBuilder](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using
the [find()](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/find) function.
You can refine the query by chaining `PublicPlansQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. PublicPlansQueryBuilder
functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryPublicPlans()` returns.
The `query()` runs with the following PublicPlansQueryBuilder defaults that you can override:
+ eq("status", "CONFIRMED")
+ skip: 0
+ limit: 50
+ descending: by createdDate
The functions that are chained to queryPublicPlans() are applied in the order they are called. For example,
if you sort on the `dateCreated` property in ascending order and then on the `id` property in ascending order,
the results are sorted first by the created date of the items and then, if there are multiple results with the
same date, the items are sorted by `id` in ascending order, per created date value.
The following PublicPlansQueryBuilder functions are supported for `queryPublicPlans()`.
|Property|Filters|Examples|

|`_id`|[`.eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`.ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`.contains()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/contains), [`.hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/hasSome), [`.in()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/in)|`.hasSome("_id", ["46ce4cd4-46ff-4aa7-9cc0-02fd4f0f3209", "94ce4cd4-46cc-4ab7-9cc0-03fd4f0f3306"])`|
|`primary` |[`.eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`.ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne)|`.eq("primary",true)`|

|`slug`|[`.eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`.ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne)[`.startsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/startsWith), [`.endsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/endsWith), [`.contains()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/contains), [`.in()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/in)|`.eq("primary",true)`|

|`dateCreated`|[`.eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`.ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`.gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/gt), [`.ge()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ge), [`.lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/lt), [`.le()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/le), [`.between()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/between)|`.lt("createdDate", "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z")`|

|`dateUpdated`|[`.eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`.ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`.gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/gt), [`.ge()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ge), [`.lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/lt), [`.le()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/le), [`.between()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/between)|`.ge("updatedDate", "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z")`|
||[`limit()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/limit)|`.limit(10)`|
||[`skip()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/skip)|`.skip(5)`|
||[`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ascending)|`.ascending(createdDate)`|
||[`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/descending)|`.descending(updatedDate)`|
||[`count()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/count)|`.count()`|
||[`find()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/find)|Execute the query: `queryPublicPlans.find()|
You can use only one filter function for each property. If a property is used in more one filter, only the first filter will work.
>**Notes:**

> + When using the queryPublicPlans() function immediately following a change to your plans, the data retrieved may not contain your most recent changes. See [Wix-data and Eventual Consistency](reference/wix-data/introduction#wix-data_introduction_wix-data-and-eventual-consistency) for more information. To solve this problem, you can use the [`setTimeout()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/JavaScript/Asynchronous/Timeouts_and_intervals#setTimeout) function to delay querying following any changes to your plans data.

> + This function builds and returns a query object containing the criteria you specified (wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/introduction). The `find()` function executes the query based on this query object, and returns the actual response, [`PublicPlansQueryResult`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryResult).

examples.title: Build and execute a query to find public plans created before a certain date.
body: export function queryPublicPlans(excludeId, skip, limit, date) {
// plans matching criteria are listed - see list below
// there was an error listing the plans

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the plan to either display or hide on the site page.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the visibility is set.

docs.summary: Sets visibility for non-archived pricing plans. Visible plans are considered public plans.
description: The `setPlanVisibility()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the plan's
visibility is set.
By default, pricing plans are public, meaning they are visible. Plans can be hidden
so that site members and visitors cannot see or choose them.
As opposed to archiving, setting visibility can be reversed. This means that a public plan
can be hidden, and a hidden plan can be made public (visible). (An archived plan always
remains archived and cannot be made active again.)
Changing a planâ€™s visibility does not impact existing orders for the plan. All orders for hidden plans are still active and keep their benefits.

examples.title: Hide a plan
body: // Plan is hidden from site members and visitors.
// Returns a promise that resolves to void.

params.name: planInfo
params.doc: The information for the plan being updated.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The updated plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Updates a pricing plan.
description: The `updatePlan() function returns a Promise that resolves to an updated plan.
Updating a plan does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases keep the details of the original plan
that was active at the time of purchase.

examples.title: Update a plan
body: "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",
*   "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: What is included with this plan (e.g., 1 weekly entrance to a specific class).

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: public
members.doc: Whether the plan is public (visible to site visitors and members).

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Number of times the same buyer can purchase the plan. An empty value or a value of zero means no limitation.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date. Defaults to false.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. Defaults to false.  If false, calling the [cancelOrder()](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error, as expected.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information will be displayed during checkout.

docs.summary: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page

docs.summary: Length of one payment cycle, e.g. 3 months to have quarterly payments.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of days, months, weeks or years.

members.name: unit
members.doc:
Days, months, weeks or years.
One of:
 + `"UNDEFINED"`
 + `"DAY"`
 + `"WEEK"`
 + `"MONTH"`
 + `"YEAR"`

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of plans created, including active plans (both public and hidden) and archived plans.

docs.summary: Amount for a single payment (or the whole subscription if it's not a recurring plan)

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

docs.summary: Object containing paging-related data (number of plans returned, offset).

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used and 'too_many_to_count' flag is not set

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used

members.doc: Plan ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: What is included with this plan (e.g., 1 weekly entrance to a specific class).

members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: public
members.doc: Whether the plan is public (visible to site visitors and members).

members.name: archived
members.doc: Whether the plan is archived. Archived plans are not visible and can't be purchased anymore, but existing purchases remain in effect.

members.name: primary
members.doc: Whether the plan is marked as primary.

members.name: hasOrders
members.doc: Whether the plan has any orders (including pending and unpaid orders).

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date plan was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date plan was last updated.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly version of plan name. Unique across all plans in the same site.

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Number of times the same buyer can purchase the plan. An empty value or a value of zero means no limitation.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date. Defaults to false.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. Defaults to false.  If false, calling the [cancelOrder()](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error, as expected.

members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information will be displayed during checkout.

docs.summary: Plan pricing details, such as the plan price, payment schedule, and expiration. The payment schedule and expiration are based on one of three pricing models: `subscription`, `singlePaymentForDuration`, or `singlePaymentUnlimited`.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan has recurring payments.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid with a single payment per cycle and what the length of the cycle is. For example, you can define a cycle of 3 months if the plan should have quarterly payments.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid in one single payment and that the plan is valid until canceled.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment (or the whole subscription if it's not a recurring plan)

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the plan in days. Available only for recurring plans, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`.

docs.summary: Plan pricing details, such as the plan price, payment schedule, and expiration. The payment schedule and expiration are based on one of three pricing models: `subscription`, `singlePaymentForDuration`, or `singlePaymentUnlimited`.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan has recurring payments.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid with a single payment per cycle and what the Length of the cycle is. For example, you can define a cycle of 3 months if the plan should have quarterly payments.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid in one single payment and that the plan is valid until canceled.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment (or the whole subscription if it's not a recurring plan)

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the plan in days. Available only for recurring plans, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`.

docs.summary: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Length of one payment cycle, e.g. 3 months to have quarterly payments.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: One time payment, plan is valid until it is canceled.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment (or the whole subscription if it's not a recurring plan)

members.name: freeTrialDays

docs.summary: Public plan entity containing information about the pricing plan. Can be read by any site member or visitor.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Plan ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: What is included with this plan (e.g., 1 weekly entrance to a specific class).

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: primary
members.doc: Whether the plan is marked as primary.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date plan was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date plan was last updated.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly version of plan name. Unique across all plans in the same site.

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Number of times the same buyer can purchase the plan. An empty value or a value of zero means no limitation.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date. Defaults to false.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. Defaults to false. If false, calling the [cancelOrder()](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error, as expected.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information will be displayed during checkout.
